title: Ticket #2730: Sizable memory leak in schedd
description:
There appears to be a pretty sizable memory leak in the schedd in trunk (c42c774). After about 3 days of running, 2 / 3 schedds are at 3GB RSS, while the third is at 300MB. All three are at about the same level of use and load.

No clue where this is coming from, about start igprof.
remarks:
2011-Dec-28 16:55:57 by bbockelm:
After running with a few days under the profiler, the majority of the leaks happen in this code path: 

WriteUserLog::writeEvent(ULogEvent*, compat_classad::ClassAd*, bool*)
WriteUserLog::writeJobAdInfoEvent(char const*, ULogEvent*, compat_classad::ClassAd*, bool)
EvalExprTree(classad::ExprTree*, compat_classad::ClassAd*, compat_classad::ClassAd*, compat_classad::EvalResult*)
strnewp(char const*)

After a few days of running, that code path resulted in about 69MB of memory leaked spread over 86k pages (335MB).

If you look at the while loop, it repeatedly calls EvalExprTree on the same result object. If that result object has previously allocated the "s" member variable, then it is leaked the second time EvalExprTree is called.

Leak appears to date back to April 2010, commit a8775968 by Dan.

According to igprof, there is an additional 36MB leaked inside Scheduler::count_jobs(). Starting at that function, 18MB comes from calls to compat_classad::ClassAd::ClassAd(), 7MB from compat_classad::ClassAd::Assign(char const*, int), and 4MB from CollectorList::sendUpdates(int, compat_classad::ClassAd*, compat_classad::ClassAd*, bool). Since they all have to do with classads, I suspect the source is the same. Haven't debugged this yet.

2011-Dec-28 18:05:33 by bbockelm:
I think the leak in count_jobs is due to the submitter ad (pAd) is new'd, but never delete'd. I'd recommend switching the allocation from the heap to the stack to prevent future issues.

In DaemonCore::Create_Process, pidtmp->child_session_id is leaked because the child_session_id is not free'd in DaemonCore::HandleProcessExit. Likely, it would be more convenient to switch this to a std::string to prevent future bugs.

2011-Dec-29 09:53:42 by danb:
The leak within WriteUserLog::writeEvent() actually appears to originate in 55917c3c when EVENT_LOG_JOB_AD_INFORMATION_ATTRS was added (2007). But, honestly, I blame classads for leaking in this case rather than the code that is calling it. I'll submit a patch that fixes it at that level.

2011-Dec-29 12:11:13 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Patch looks good, thanks Brian and Dan!

Don't forget to merge to master (current it is not)...

2011-Dec-29 12:27:20 by danb:
Brian, I don't see how pidtmp->child_session_id can be leaked unless pidtmp is also leaked. The PidEntry destructor frees child_session_id. I can run further tests if you still think something is wrong.
